data.title: Great food
data.text: We really enjoyed this new find.  Excellent food. The wait staff were very helpful and friendly. There is seating as you walk in and there is seating upstairs.  We were upstairs and I think that is the best spot.  The roasted beet salad was very good and the gyro was also.  Thoroughly enjoyed our dinner.  We will go back

data.title: Gyros..mmmmm
data.text: This is a great place to have lunch and dinner is offered as well.  Great food, good prices and good service.

data.title: Great lunch!
data.text: Had lunch and visited with a friend.  The atmosphere was great and the service was too.  The food tasted great!

data.title: Very good food and service
data.text: I cant speak to how "authentic" it is, but I have always enjoyed the food and the service. I have heard stories from others who were less than thrilled, but what can I say, I really like this place. Downstairs decor us a little cheesy but upstairs is nice. It's a good place for casual dining or a dressier affair.

data.title: Their salad is as great as this photo shows!
data.text: I have eaten there several times.  They have a really good wine...can't think of the name but the bottle shows a silhouette of a man, standing, with a hat on his head. Their salads are very fresh abundant (generous portions) .  They have a lovely assortment of true Mediteranean main dishes as well as desserts.  Great service.  Cozy atmosphere. Tables upstairs in the loft and downstairs on main level.  Wheelchair access.

data.title: A taste of the Mediterrainean
data.text: This place is one of the jewels downtown. They feature genuine Greek fare in a pleasant atmosphere. Dining room features a mezzanine level in addition to the main seating area. The building is an older historic one but nicely renovated without any loss of character, and is walking distance from the downtown square. Classic Greek menu with everything you would expect. The food is extremely well prepared and of high quality with a classy presentation. The experience feels like an upper class restaurant but perfectly balanced in a casual mood. The servers are professionals; knowledgeable, attentive and very personable. I have been there several times now and found this experience to be very consistent; it is very well managed. Best of all is the value; high quality food, great service, wonderful atmosphere...all at a very modest price point.

data.title: What a pleasant surprise - yes you should try it
data.text: Made our reservations, sat right up front by the window, great service and great food.  Started with appetizers which were fab, especially the calamari. Our table ordered mostly Greek and I ordered Italian. All our food was served hot and had great flavor. After all of us eating dinner, we stayed for dessert and coffee. We will return and recommend Feta.

data.title: Decent food at a good price
data.text: We stopped here for lunch on our way to a cruise. The food was good and the service was pretty good. We may stop here again.

data.title: Great Taste
data.text: I went to feta with my wife and had to said it was a great experience, not only great food but good service. Food was a Greek /Italian combination. Although they have a good wine selection you can bring and enjoy your own bottle for $15.00.

data.title: What happened?
data.text: A few months ago we went here for the first time with a great experience!  Last week, we took the kids for a cultural lunch...we had bad service, the server didn't know what was in the food (as I have several allergies), and didn't bother to find out until after she brought the food.  Therefore, I ended up paying for a platter for two which I could only eat one thing off of and a dessert I couldn't eat at all.  The food is excellent here but my last experience was disappointing.  She didn't refill the drinks and didn't know her menu.  Two very important things in the service industry.

data.title: Yummy food
data.text: Feta is a great place. Every time we have been there the food has been delicious. The service is amazing.

data.title: Lunch while passing through
data.text: We were passing through Ocala at around lunch time. We looked at the restaurant reviews and included Feta in our choice. It's just a block off of US 301/27/441, so it was the first we came across. Serendipity! We are welcomed at “Feta” with a hearty “Yassou kalimera”. We later learn that our server is from Puerto Rico, speaking fluent Spanish, but just two words of Greek. We order some mezes and a combo platter of all kinds of Greek cuisine. We know it’s very touristy, but today we feel like tourists, so what the heck. Good choice...everything was very good and we left our plates quite clean.  Just one critizism - the Greek salad had lettuce!

data.title: Dinner with Friends
data.text: This is the third time we have been here because we live in the area. The first two times were good, this time not so good. My husband and I ordered the sampler plate and didn't like most of what was on it. What we did like was overcooked. Our friends split a dish that was basically beef stew. It said nothing like that in the description and the waitress didn't tell them. The waitress acted new but had been there awhile. She kept forgetting things and had to keep coming back after we asked her over and over again. We had coffee after dinner and the cream was bad. She was happy to bring me more but it was more of the same. Bad service, not so good food. Very disappointed this time and not sure we'll be back.

data.title: Mostly wonderful
data.text: This is a highly recommended restaurant in Ocala by people who live in the area. My husband, the other couple and I all love Greek food and all of us enjoyed what we ordered except my husband. The stuffed grape leaves were the best I've ever had as was the pastichio. Also ordered was Greek salad, fried calamari, and meat kabobs. My husband ordered a seafood and pasta dish which he ate but didn't enjoy: too salty and too spicy hot. The waitress told him they could make something else for him, etc. but he declined the offer. He was turned off that the moussaka on the menu was made with beef, not lamb. If you are a lover of lamb, there are just a few items in the menu featuring that. The place is charming in decor, 2 floors, good beer and wine list, and very good service. I would go back again! As we were leaving, the waitress handed a free dessert to go to my husband. They felt badly about his not enjoying his dinner.

data.title: Authentic Greek
data.text: The food at Feta is delicious, authentic Greek food. This is a family owned business, the owner is working hard in the kitchen, preparing the food. My favorite is their Mousaka, Dolmades and even their pizza is delicious. So many choices. All fresh and delicious.

data.title: Night Out with Friends
data.text: A little difficult to locate with unique parking lot.  Food was good but my wife's gyro could have used more meat.  Prices were o.k., but certainly not cheap.  The lamb burger I had was very good.  Has both a small downstairs seating area, as well as an upstairs area.  Will probably return.

data.title: great taste
data.text: very fresh, i enjoyed all of it, love the fresh tiny tomatoes, and lettuce, fresh cucumbers, i take off the olives and cheese, and use a balsamic vinegar dressing.

data.title: Finally...authentic Greek Food
data.text: Passing through central Florida and found this outstanding gem.  My husband is Greek and his family has taught me great Greek cooking, so I am very fussy about eating Greek food in a restaurant.  However, Dimitri did not disappoint.  The moussaka was very authentic and prepared with a gourmet touch.  The saganaki was the usual show with an extremely tasty cheese.  My husband had the keftede and lamb burger and thought both were moist and seasoned perfectly.  So two thumbs up for this spot.  We hope to stop by again when we are visiting family in Florida

data.title: Very Satisfied
data.text: If your looking for true traditional Greek food then this is it and it's located in an old historical building that has a lot of character

data.title: delicious food and kind staff
data.text: As we sat and looked at what other tables ordered, it all looked/smelled amazing.  I love to try as many dishes as possible, so the sampler entree was the perfect choice for me.  It came with a decent portion of 5 different items.  My guest got the lamb burger and was also impressed. I grabbed baklava for dessert.  We arrived around 8pm and it was not crowded at all.  It was a wonderful experience and I look forward to going back again.
